title.narrative: OUTPUT 4 : RESILIENT Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) Development - The MoWI and selected counties have strengthened capacity to implement climate resilient WASH programmes, and deliver timely and effective emergency responses during humanitarian crises., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Salaries and Related costs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Resilient WASH Development - The MoWI and selected counties have strengthened capacity to implement climate resilient WASHprogrammes, and deliver timely and effective emergency responses during humanitarian crises.

description.narrative: In response to cholera outbreaks, drought and severe floods, UNICEF restored 45,500 people&39;s access to permanent safe water supplies, and a further 188,000 with temporary access to safe water. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/06/2018

title.narrative: WASH sector plans integrating climate resilient development and/or risk management strategies available

UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations accessing sufficient quantity of water of appropriate quality for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene
Existence of functioning cluster coordination mechanism for water, sanitation and hygiene in humanitarian situations
